result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Werlein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED - if completes 50 hours community service no later than 9/23/15 then jail will be vacated.
If remains crime free for 18 months, can request expungement.

records.addlTxt: Bond money from Polk county case posted.

from Colin, Jail  to Andrea, Br 4   re: has def completed CS?  If not he was supposed to report to jail on 9-23-15 but never showed up
Per SLH:  Looks  to me like he's done - send to COC
from def   re: community service work completed - see attachments
Risk Assessment
Amended

10:03 AM - Def in court w/Atty S. Joseph Randtke.  Edward Minser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
consolidate Polk County case into this one. 
Amended Information filed
Ct. 1 -  Theft - Guilty
Ct. 2 - CDP - guilty
Ct. 3 (Polk Cty case) - dismissed and read in
COMPAS filed  
 Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs/meds in the last 24 hrs
  Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
MINSER: recommending probation. He and C. S. broke into the Rockland Stop N Go. He's paid his 1/2 of the rest up front. His first go w/ the adult system. RANDTKE: he paid the $750 this morning. I think he will get his life together and take care of this matter. DEF: I am trying to make myself better. My parents are involved in helping me do so.  CRT: Looking at Smith's record  and he was given 31 days credit and I felt no penalty beyond that was approp. In this case there is 5 days credit. There are no real needs based on the COMPAS. Rest has bene paid. MINSER: the rational for probation is that the seriousness of the underlying crimes. Understand there are no needs in the COMPAS  but he's getting the benefit of expunction. RANDTKE: If I were to think of the purpose of probation and using the DOC's time v. contributing to the community, as a potential alt structure give him an imposed and stayed jail time if he doesn't complete com service hrs. CRT: in the absence of any identifiable  needs DOC's resources are scarce and they are short staffed. Low risk people don't do well when associating w/ higher risk people in the DOC
SENTENCE: 30 days CJ STAYED - def to complete 50 hrs com service no later than 9/23 then the jail will be vacated. Pay file + CC for a total of $905.00
ext: def to pay $100/mo eff 9/1 or CJ
as to  973.015 trmt, will find that def will benefit and he was under 25 but will Defer finding of no harm to community for 18 mos and if he remains crime free I will look at it and he will need to make that request
appeared late - warrant vacated

Polk Co 15CM104
